<pre> warning
== The QA trackers no longer include the option to include this information ==
</pre>

 

While reporting test results on the isotracker or other qatrackers, there is an OPTIONAL field you can enter the URL you generate below. This describes how to generate it.

== Hardware ==

   ''(Please follow the instructions on this page very carefully and edit  '''only'''  the TOP TABLE. If you need help with editing a wiki page, just ask.)''

When developers receive testing results, look at bug reports, or discuss technical issues, they may need you to submit detailed information about your computer. This report includes such things as: the type of CPU, the kind of memory, and other important hardware specifications. Adding your 'quick link' from here reduces the time which would be wasted if they need ask you to post up additional information, then you getting it and posting it up. It is much faster if you include your link in the bug report / discussion  at the beginning. If they do not need it, they need not click on the link.

Developers ask such things as: '''''"please include the output of lsusb, lspci, cpuproc, etc."'''''

'''This does NOT report personal data from your computer.''' This means that your passwords and other sensitive information remain safe.

Once your weblink has been logged and securely archived, you simply need to copy / paste the link into your testing and bug reports.

=== PROCEDURE ===

==== A. Install these three applications (from the trusted standard Ubuntu repositories): ====

* '''hardinfo''' - Gets the information.
* '''gist''' - Sends the information to Gist.
* '''clipit''' - Reports back the link.

'''Note''' - Most newer versions of Ubuntu should have "hardinfo" already installed.

Simply copy/paste the command below into your <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UsingTheTerminal | terminal]]</nowiki>:

<pre>
sudo apt-get install hardinfo gist clipit
</pre>

You will be asked for your password. After that, just answer '''Y''' to all the questions.

==== B. Run the command to get your pastebin link: ====

When the installations complete, remain in your <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UsingTheTerminal | terminal]]</nowiki>, run or copy/paste the command below. Press ENTER, and the command will run. Ignore the error comments that it throws up. You will see your '''Gist link''' upon completion.
<pre>
hardinfo -ram devices.so | sed '/\*\*\*\*\*\*\*/,/\*\*\*\*\*\*\*/d' | gist-paste | clipit -c
</pre>

The link will look similar to this, altered for your personal information: '''https://gist.github.com/21f8c126a7f490ff2935'''

If you do not see the link, it might be because the clipit step did not work. Try again, deleting the clipit portion of the command line:
<pre>
hardinfo -ram devices.so | sed '/\*\*\*\*\*\*\*/,/\*\*\*\*\*\*\*/d' | gist-paste
</pre>

   '''''NOTE ABOUT MAKING ANOTHER LINK''':  If you need to generate another link (for example, if you change your  hardware,) you need only to copy and paste the code from '''Part B''', as the applications installed during ('''Step  A ''') were installed permanently.''

==== C. Add Your link to the TOP TABLE ====

Update only the TOP TABLE, by copying in your Gist link, under SPECIFICATIONS. Please fill in the other details as indicated below. (If you are not familiar with editing wiki pages, please just get in touch with us.)  Then, bookmark this page for handy access to your link.

The bottom table is for holdovers from a legacy system that needs to be ported over. Eventually, it will go away.
